text:
This place is crap...... The service was crappy and management should be fired. Why call yourself a sports bar when you cater to one team only. Yes, we know there a bunch of 49ers in there but the game did not come on until 1:15, if people are in there watching games you should respect that. DO NOT turn all the TVs to one game when people are obviously watching several different games especially during playoffs and the game is down to the last minute. HOW DO YOU DO THAT??? at least put the game on in the back or tell the bar..... something. 

 When we went to voice a complaint Gary Bogel THE MANAGER said to us its a 49er bar and turned his back on us what an a$$.  And no Gary it's Timbers Bar & Grill it does not say anywhere 49er's Bar and Grill, if I knew that I would have gone somewhere else.  

Food was OK, but the stringy black-haired  bartender was horrible.  She should know that crack kills, especially when sporting a muffin top. They can bet we won't be back to that place.

All you 49er Fans, this is the bar to go and watch the games. They have a enough TVs so everyone gets a chance to see the action. However, it does get really crowded with so if you want a good seat you have to arrive an hour before the game. The beer is only $3.50. Also when the Niners score you get a free jello shot. 

The service here is okay but they get a bit confused because they don't even keep track of who ordered what.

My spouse and I go here alot, every week,food was great, super atmosphere,but now not so much as of 3-3-15. Waited a long time for a  sandwich, fries were stale and cold, and by the time we got fresh ones, the sandwich was cold.Atmosphere was very unfamiliar, not welcoming anymore, what happened?? Will not be revisiting this location anymore

Meh.

Not great, not bad, just ok.  When I walked in, I was worried it would be a dive.  It was close, but not too bad.  Good enough to hang out for a couple drinks.

The waitress was very attentive and really helpful with the food order, checking to see if the oil was peanut free (it wasn't).

The drinks were good enough, but I'm not sure why a Sunrise Margarita would be brownish in color.  I ordered another, so it tasted good enough.  While the drink looked the same, it tasted different, so I don't know what it was or if the person mixing drinks knew what they were doing.

Not bad, but again not great.  Good enough.

Meh.
Great new menu! Biscuit sliders are yum!  The biscuits are fluffy and fresh! And breakfast is served all day and night!

Had dinner here recently, and had to come on here to comment on our server Annemarie. She was absolutely incredible! Very attentive, personable, and made great menu and drink suggestions. She definitely made our visit fun and more enjoyable. The food was great and overall our visit was excellent - way above average! Thanks Timbers and Annemarie for a great experience for us tourists ;)

I never write reviews but this place is a joke. We came here before and they ended charging my girlfriend 9 beers when she had 4 because she was still very sober. It was a big group so we gave them the benefit of the doubt even though we were unhappy. We still came in after despite being screwed over and it was not that bad. 

However, I went in and gambled 75.00 dollars and drank 15.00 worth of beer and found out I was going to have to start a tab. I was upset but I said I would pay. The bartender grab my beer and threw it down the drain along with my water and later ask me to leave. Don't waste your time here because they are no different than a corporate place with awful service and bartenders. All this over five beers. Go someplace else. They will screw you over some how.
The food was pretty good. Amazing grilled cheese sandwich. The server was awesome! The beer not so good. They seemed to be out of everything but Bud Light.
The food at Timbers is ok but their service is lacking.  This is nearby my work so I have been here a few times and the service got worse each time.  It is a waste of money to be a patron here.

Breakfast all day and it's good. But service is sketchy, depending on who is working. I have gone and had great service, (2/25) and have gone in and been ignored like I was not there (2/26). I will try it again, but management should get its act together or this place could also close, which would be too bad and is unnecessary... Just give good service.

I moved here from Illinois And  I'm checking out the area I stopped in here about 3weeks ago and had a good meal.the waitress was great.
I went back and saw the same waitress and she recognized me and that impressed me and mad me feel good. Unfortunately she was not my server that night.the gal I had was awful thank goodness the Ariana was there she did more for me that night than the 
Server I had did.
I want back last night and made sure I sat in 
Ariana's area. As soon as I came in she saw me and I felt like I was one of the regulars there. She makes my day every time.
I will make this me local place to go from now on. Arianna is great every place needs a person like this working for them.
Keep up the Great work Ariana !!!!

Mine and my girlfriends favorite bar. We love the atmosphere as well as  the friendly staff. We are always treated like family. As for the food. It is amazing and the drinks are never a disappointment.  Strong and delicious they are. If you ever want a place to go for some amazing low priced breakfast in the am or pm then this is the place to go.  Huge breakfast portions which I love.

Not a place for non-smokers. I'm pretty sure they violating the indoor clean air act since they serve food. It was a smoke pit so we left. Server seemed irritated when I told her it was our first time here and we were non-smokers. Don't want the second hand smoke. No thanks.
Great mozzarella sticks, good western sliders. The nachos we very sad. Had to send the back. The server was ok. I like the atmosphere in there. Totally laid back. I will give this a 75%.
Not good. Not a good taste. The food taste like it was thrown together. Do not recommend eating there. At All!!

Went in a few months ago. Ordered the Timbers Burger and found 4 long blond hairs in it!! District Manager apologized and gave me his card with 2 free dinners. Why would I come back to eat here?? Will NEVER go back.

Love this bar!!always a good time. Bar tenders are always friendly. Ceanna is the best server I've ever had ! Come to the bar at least once a week! Definitely
Recommend!

Great food. Friendly staff. I like this bar. The machines are a little tight, so gaming here is not ideal. The day shift bartender is awesome. Her name is Jamie. So, come stop by and visit with her. The food here is pretty good, come hungry. I had the hamburger and for under $6, it was delicious.

This particular timbers deserves no stars.......I ordered food for delivery and not only did I wait for 3 hours to get my food but it was ice cold and the not the way I ordered it and some of it they didn't put in the bag I called the restaurant and the three people were no help at all they just kept blaming grubhub to which I've ordered through grubhub many many times and never had a problem the manager didn't take responsibility for anything he just kept blaming grubhub so long story short don't get delivery from timbers matter of fact don't patronize them at all until they learn how to read a computer screen and take responsibility for their actions and wrong doings I know I'm totally done doing business with them they went as far to blame the delivery driver and it was so not her fault

My husband and I had our first date here, and some of the staff still remember us after 3 years. That said, we don't make it out too often, because we live across town, but this is by far my favorite Timbers. The bartenders know how to have fun, the crowd is always local, drinks are free if you're playing machines at the bar, they have lots of TV's and big wing back chairs, and the menu is good. 

If you dig fish-n-chips, these guys have pretty much nailed it. They've finally jumped on the sweet potato fries bandwagon, and you can sub them for regular fries if you feel the need. You can get breakfast 24 hours a day, which is a huge plus, and the grilled cheese here is EPIC. They call it (something like) the Ultimate Grilled Cheese, although I'm not completely sure - my neurons only fire for the taste of the thing. If I recall, they don't always have it on the menu, but maybe that will change. They put a couple different cheeses inside the most delicious bread, add bacon (mmmmmmmm...... bacon.....) and big slices of tomato, which stay cold in spite of the piping hot sandwich. Then they smash the whole thing into the skillet with loads of butter and shredded Parmesan cheese, which makes a droolworthy crust. 

All food aside, you will leave this place smelling of smoke, especially if you go during peak hours. Is it worth it? Oh, yeah!

Love this Timbers.  Great local crowd and always a good vibe in there.

I think Timbers offers some of the best bar food in town also.  The turkey sliders are awesome!  

Good bartenders at this spot, and always a pretty cool people in there.

Yikes. I have been to other Timbers and the experience was not the same. 
First, my husband and I got the 2 for 1 drink special-he got beer and I got the margarita because they were out of cider. They brought both drinks out at once which I thought was weird so we were chugging to try not to let the other one get warm.
Second, the margarita was nasty. Had the weirdest taste.
Third, my husband got the chili with texas toast. The chili was  fine, but the toast was SO SALTY. It was inedible. Nearly everything we had was so salty we could hardly eat it. I got the buffalo chicken wrap which was decent, but the fries were over salted also.
We will not be returning unless to have solely beer that is not on the happy hour so we can get one at a time.

Service was good from the waitress Stephanie but the bartender was very rude and only cared about his patrons at the bar no body else... I chose this bar to celebrate my birthday and this guy could care less..the Coper keg just down the street was a better choice,.,

We didn't want to drive downtown so we found this place down the street. The place is fairly decent on the smoke-factor, but this is Vegas so everyone should be used to it. LOL - The Chivas & water was solid and they've got Guinness on tap so that's always a plus!! Two pool tables are always a good time to spend with family!

Heather and staff were amazing and any yelp review you have read were very misguided. . Sweet attentive and fun to be around with great conversation!  Please come in and judge for yourself and have a great night at a great local bar. Used to come here 7 yrs ago and I obviously think it's much better. Got hungry and got takin care of asap! Great burger and fries with my beer  come in the afternoon and show some love have a good time

I actually really love the food from Timbers. We usually Postmates from this restaurant, and everything always comes perfect. LOVE the sandwiches, wraps and burgers. They are generous with the sizes and it's delicious. We went in once to order takeout and the staff wasn't very attentive, and the atmosphere isn't really my vibe. However, we'll definitely keep ordering food from them when we feel like a good burger that's not fast food.

First time in Vegas trip. I tried this place out for the first time. It was a let down from the beginning, thanks to the bartender Amanda. I asked if they had hot sauce for my nachos, and she rudely says that I was already given salsa. I also asked for a fork a minute later and she laughed at me. I started getting concerned about my visit here and why bartender Amanda was acting out poor customer service skills. I later asked if they had 3 different types of alcohols, in which they did not. Instead of Amanda saying "No" or "Sorry", she replied with "We're only Timbers" which gave me the impression that she, herself, considers her work under par.  Another patron accidentally called her a different name, and then apologized when she corrected him on her real name. She still snapped back and stated "How would you like it if I called you Peter?" Finally, I found a scotch and asked for it. She poured it into a shot glass, and Isaid "Oh sorry, can I get it on the rocks?" And she yelled at me for not telling her sooner (One dirty shot glass shouldn't be a big deal).  I finally got my bill. I received 2 drinks on my bill which I did not order. Amanda refused to take them off and said that she already helped me enough and that she isn't breaking the rules. I didn't know what to do other than pay and not leave a tip. This was a horrible first Vegas experience. I will NOT reccommend this place to anyone. This girl needs to be fired, however, I'm sure that won't happen.

The nachos were decent... but customer satisfaction is everything.

We arrived at 2:55 am after a very long night.  We just wanted some breakfast.  We ordered a water and an iced tea to drink, because it was 3am and we just wanted some food.  The server was visibly irritated that we weren't ordering alcohol and apparently assumed we wouldn't tip.  Bad guess since my gf and I both work in the industry.  I always tip menu prices at happy hours.

She brought our menus and did not return to take our order for 15-20 minutes.  We ordered and didn't get our food for another half hour.  Fifteen minutes earlier the waitress told us our food was "almost done."

When the food arrived it was cold.  So the food was done when we were told it was almost done.  The place was nearly empty and no one is that incompetent.  She purposefully sandbagged our order for over an hour to punish us for not drinking at 3am

We didn't get out until 4:15

So, I must preface that I am not a gambler and my party days are behind me but I am happy to report that this place isn't any less enjoyable if you aren't coming here to gamble or drink lots. 

Centennial lacks bars and late night food options majorly, but luckily Timbers comes to the rescue because Distill sucks! 

Service is good. Happy hour is great. 2.50 drinks and the food is super cheap, too. Each month in the summer months another menu item is half off during happy hour, July is burgers! 

Christin is the server when I always come in and she is honestly half the reason I keep coming back. 

She has a great attitude, she's fast and efficient, and she doesn't treat us badly because we don't drink when we come. It's all about the food! 

The rest of the staff seems friendly, but no where near as great as Christin. I will definitely keep coming back as long as she's serving!

Slow service to start. Once Christin took over our table, she was great. GF and I shared a Philly cheesesteak and mozzarella sticks. We had 2 drafts. The mozzarella sticks were really good but came out with the cheesesteak. The cheesesteak was mediocre. It was fairly dry. Value wasn't bad especially with a coupon. We will try it again to see how it goes.

I usually despise chain bars like Timbers and PT's Pub.  This place was really smoky!

This is one of the few places in Vegas that has darts...so it gets an extra star just for that.  

We stopped in to watch an Oregon Duck game because we called ahead and they said that they have the PAC-12 network.  When we got there, they said they actually don't, and they gave us a couple of shots to brighten our mood!  The manager and one of the bartender girls were great.

First time here, we had great service.
The second time, they couldn't find the game on the tv. The waitress forgot half the order, I asked for extra cranberry juice for my vodka and she charged me 2 bucks for that on top of the drink charge.  By the time we left, one person at our table still didn't have the food they ordered and it was 2 hours later.
I wont be back.
Food was not so great. Our waitress, Lucia, was awesome though. If you are looking for good food go elsewhere.
Haven't visited Timbers for awhile.. Had a  fantastic night! Great conversation and awesome service! Thank you Rob and Heather! We will be back!

Poker bar food that isn't horrible.  

Lunchtime:  

The pizza is ok but I suspect it just a better than average frozen crust.  It doesn't taste fresh...  but it is better than Chucky Cheese.  

The cheeseburger is above average.  I almost REALLY like it.  It has a good taste... for the first half but I am usually not enjoying it s much once I pass the halfway point.  The sides of fries, rings, etc are just US Foods frozen standards.  

Breakfast:

The scrambled eggs are fresh but the cook needs to learn to use salt and pepper.  The toast was pretty good, though not spectacular.  

Overall, I wouldn't come here for the food.  If you are looking for some tasty cold ones and Gamblers Bonus machines, this isn't a bad choice.
Have always had great service and good food and drinks at this location and it's not overly Smokey
Yeah, service can be VERY sketchy.  "One day is chicken, the next day is feathers".  The Management/Owners, SOME BODY!  needs to fix this this..... we wont be back just to be ignored......again.

I am so upset that they have changed their turkey burgers!! The Baja Turkey Burger used to be the best around. Now not so much it was even pink inside!!! I'm still a regular because I love the amazing people that work here! But no more turkey burgers
Your standard bar far with a unique atmosphere.  Pull up a big leather bond arm chair and enjoy some beer with a friend.  Lot's of televisions, low light, a pool table, and decent wait service.

Very bad service 1-29-16 ! Waitress got our order all screwed up. Delivered our apptizzer but no utensils or plates. Took our order back because we ordered a Bacon cheeseburger and there was no Bacon. They brought back the the Burger to find out it wasn't a fresh one. They just added Bacon to it which was not really cooked fully. The Burger was cold already and they didn't even change the paper on the plastic tray. Our old Ketchup was still there and didn't look presentable. I asked for a Manager and they sent one our way and explained this whole misery. I told him that we are done and won't be back. At least he said he'll take care of it. My opinion I give 0 STARS. Besides the point I felt the bad vibe in there cuz we were minority's. REAL TALK !!! Besides it all change after they converted this bar from a 49ers bar to Steelers bar

I heard they had great burgers so I had to stop in and form my own opinion.  As well as share it on Yelp. What makes a great budget is the total of all components combined perfected and fulfill ones hunger need while satisfying taste buds.  

I ordered the classic cheeseburger medium with fries. Upon delivery the burger came out to a perfect medium as requested.   The patty was a thick 1/2 pounder hand formed with some tools I'm sure.   Very juicy but lacked seasoning.  No problem I can just add my own.  Topped wirh lettuce tomato and onion, my Burger was delivered quickly and with a large portion of fries, a pound at least.  I could see that my hunger pains would subside after this meal because I never let anything go to waste.  

My one issue with this burger was the bun.  It was so squishy and soft it could not hold up to this big old burger.   Don't get me wrong I enjoyed it.  This is just area I would improve on.  The pickle and Italian peppers on the side were a nice addition and both were crispy and fresh.  

Service from Rich was attentive and courteous.  So much so that I will most likely be back to explore more of the menu.   I really enjoyed the reasonably priced Sierra Nevada beers and looking at the marketing materials posted throughout the location the prices get better between 4-7 for happy hour.

Been to this location twice now, and same experience as the last. My boyfriend and I were ignored because the staff was too busy chatting with the OBNOXIOUSLY LOUD regulars. Repeatedly had to wait more than 5 minutes for our "cash out" money. Bartenders seemed thoroughly annoyed that we wanted to cash out $5 and try a different machine. The machines are super tight. 

The bartenders are rude. They never asked if we needed anything. Had to basically yell to get their attention. 

Food wasn't horrible. Would consider ordering the Western Philly with au jus again. 

But the staff. I seriously can't get over how awful the staff was. Even with two bartenders, both of them stopped to talk to the same group of people for 20+ minutes. 

We go to this location because it's close to home if we need to walk home. Guess we will be bringing cab money and finding a new bar to frequent on date night.

Come for the Onion Rings! 

Timbers on Durango serves good bar grub and drinks to quench your thirst. This location receives a fair share of two and one  star ratings from Yelpers. In my opinion, the Onion Rings rate FIVE stars. Overall for food, service and atmosphere (think beer, pool & darts joint), this Timbers location warrants a solid THREE star rating - A-OK. 

***THE AWESOME ONION RINGS***
You get a full basket of thick succulent rings that are perfectly breaded & seasoned. Their ORs are truly a bite of sweet onion goodness. Add a little hot sauce (Cholula for me) or your favorite dip. Crunchy, delicious and satisfying. The basket will easily subdue two very hungry appetites for starters.  
 
The food is good bar grub. Nothing fancy! Expect real bar food without the frills & obnoxious presentation. I had the grilled fish tilapia tacos. Fresh tasting filet and Pico de Gallo. I go light on the white Baja sauce so not to overpower the other flavors. 

No rants regarding service here. My servers have always been pleasant, even when tables and barstools are full. 

Whenever I'm thirsty for a cold beer and long for my favorite Onion Rings, I'll most likely be at Timbers.

This place reminds me of how video poker Bars were when I first moved to Vegas 15 years ago. Winning is never guaranteed, and often unlikely, but the machines give you back and forth play and allow you to enjoy yourself for more than a minute or two. Great music through a decent sound system, and the presence of Billiards and Golden Tee give this establishment the opportunity to be a little bit more fun then some run-of-the-mill video poker bars. I feel like darts would be a good addition but I understand why they don't have it. Jeffrey the late night bartender is a joy, he took the time to offer me a food menu and was personable and polite. I would highly recommend this place to anyone just looking to take a few minutes play a few dollars and enjoy a beer and some great music. That said I've had their food before, primarily breakfast, and it has always been at least par or above. The only thing that I could ask for that I did not receive during my visit was a profitable win, but what kind of jerk would I be if I gave them a 4-star rating because of my unlucky gambling

I probably go here 2-3 times a week, and I find I always get good service, even when they're crazy busy, it's still fast, friendly service. The drinks are strong, the food is good, especially the Killer Grilled Cheese, The weekend morning crew is good as well as the swing shift crew. I  never had bad service or food/drink at this Timbers.

I love the food and the ambience here; as long as it's not too crowded. The reason I don't like it when it's crowded is that it's then difficult to get away from smokers -- but then this is typical in any Las Vegas bar, unfortunately. My favorite place to eat is is one of the easy chairs in front of the fireplace. 

The bar tends to be crowded, so I rarely gamble here. Too many smokers who just light right up and hold their cigarettes next to you. I know smoking is allowed in bars, but wonder why so many smokers have no manners. Sometimes a kind smoker with great manners will sit next to me and will actually ask if cigarettes bother me and I'll thank them for asking and ask them to just keep the smoke on their other side (side not next to me). This makes all the difference to me!
Update:   We tried Timbers again and had a great time. Jason was awesome.  We will definitely be back.     The Club wrap and housemade chips were delicious.
Good food and atmosphere. Friendly staff and I enjoy coming by every now and then for a drink or breakfast menu.

I like this place despite the fact I walked out smelling like an ash tray. I'm looking forward to watching some Niner games games here. The bar food starts out pretty good, a little salty but with several beers in you the food gets flipping awesome!! Another plus is watching the guys trying to hit on the few girls that are in here :-) I don't really feel special getting hit on here it's just a lack of supply with high demand ;-) Either way it's very entertaining to watch it all go down :-) ohhh and the waitresses...one of them is a sweet little thang and the other one I had was miss personality :-P lol

They serve RED BEER here! 

Red Beer, aka, "Micheledas", is beer mixed with clamato or tomato juice with hot sauce, pepper, and lime, all that goodness in one drink is only $3.50!!!

They have 2 pool tables so if you want to hang out with some friends to "shoot" the S*** this is a great place to go to. Every now and then you will see some good looking guys (if you're a single girl) but for the most part, this place doesn't get all that at all.. just a nice place to relax.

Heathers rocks...great service...excellent food.  Great place to hang out after work
Fun place

I really like the place how it's laid out. I enjoyed being at a bar with decent food. Had a pretty good waiter. The food was okay in my opinion. Nothing to great but decent prices. I really enjoyed the happy hour around dinner time! 2.50$ for a glass of their Chardonnay was very good ! The side salad was pretty tasty. My BBQ burger was not bad, I think it could have used more season or just something more to it. The happy hour at this place really got me though cause usually it's to late or doesn't exist in my time frame haha! I would definitely come here again only thing different is I would try the fried chicken sandwich or maybe one of their wraps. Not a bad burger though.

I have been here a couple times now for food . The wings I got the other night were burnt . I went this morning to get breakfast and asked for the steak medium rare and it was well done . The eggs sunny side up and they were so dry . The potatoes weren't cooked all the way . I normally like going to timbers for food but I always go to the Cheyenne and ft Apache one . This was such a disappointment . I won't be getting food from this location again .
I think Timbers has by far the best bar food in town. As far as the service goes, I've had different experiences. Sometimes it's great, sometimes it's not.

Overpriced! 4 drinks and a side of fries came out to be around $70! So Beware! Also, we had to scream for our bartender 5 times before she stopped talking to her friend to come check us out. 

The setup is great though. Seems like a friendly atmosphere. Wouldn't spend the money here again.

My roommate and I were so heated  over how much this bar just sucked ass that I got on my phone and opened my Yelp account for the first time in a long time to write this review. 

My roommate and I both stopped in here to get a bite to eat. We arrived around 2:45am and sat at the bar. The bartender Richard was busy pouring beers for a group (assuming a birthday was going on cause I kept hearing "OMG happy birthday!" Countless times over at the group) so he didn't greet us for 5-10 mins until he was at his POS machine and looked up saying "I'll be right with you guys". Meanwhile my roommate decided to go ahead and play some blackjack. He's a pretty big gambler so I knew it was gonna be a lot. 

2 mins later he walked up asked us what we would like to drink and my roommate just wanted a water and a classic burger that was $4.50 and I got a Monster energy that was probably $3.50-4 and a beef Philly that was $9.50. Food arrived about 15-20 mins later and my Philly was extremely dry not even the mayo I asked for in it could help it. The fries were good and my roommate said his burger was good. After we were done eating our food my roommate was gambling to whole time and already put in $250+ in the machine needless to say he was also getting upset because the machine was just not busting. The bartender came up and gave us our bill to our surprise and on it was my philly and my roommates $4.50 burger. 

My roommate got heated. In all of our years going to bars we have never had a bartender give us a ticket for a $5 item after we gambled hundreds of dollars.
Most places don't charge us a cent because of the amount he gambles or whenever I gamble as well.
You just don't do that it's insulting to the guest especially when he lost his ass off. 

My roommate then asked the bartender if they didn't comp food and the bartender then took the ticket back and changed it real quick to just my philly on it. I was okay paying for that because I didn't gamble at all but the ONLY reason why I tipped him was because he took my monster off. 
Maybe it's because we didn't order alcohol and he assumed we wouldn't know any better and just thought that we thought only drinks could be comped when you gamble. 
Well that was a BAD move on his part because what he didn't know was both my roommate and I are seasoned gambling bartenders with years of experience and if he would of just comped our whole bill he would of had an easy $20 tip headed his way instead of the $3 I gave him. Even better we would of came back. 

But now because of this horrible service we won't be coming back. We will take our money elsewhere. Better to use some Comps and explain to a manager then to explain to a guest and lose that guest. Especially gamblers! 

The only reason why I would consider coming back and giving this place 2 stars instead of the 1 star it does deserve because of our night was because I happened to stop in here the other morning with my other roommate for some breakfast and a beer and the morning bartender Jamie was awesome! Fun to talk to, comped my beer and food and made sure we were happy the entire time. If I do come back it will be when she works.

Stopped in mid-morning on a Monday and had to get buzzed in. I am all for being security minded, but I was a little baffled by the buzzer during regular business hours in broad daylight. Went in for breakfast to continue the quest for the ultimate chicken fried steak. The CFS was good, as was the accompanying pancake. However, the hash browns were a little undercooked and served less than lukewarm . The service was a slower than would be expected, as we were the only ones in the joint at the time., Overall it was just an average experience but I will be back, as I have long been a fan of Timbers and this was my first visit to this location.

I have been frequenting this bar for over 10 years. Let me say that again ten whole years. I am not one to be bias or give praise and acknowledgement when it's not due. But over these past ten years every time I have gone into that establishment they have always taken care of me very well. The food is great the service is great too. I have read many reviews on Yelp today and it makes me sad because apparently some people think that if a bartender is not all over you 24/7 giving you everything you want, that's bad service. I don't go every day like many of the VIPS do, but they still treat me great. I don't even have to gamble much to get great service. I'm also not one to not put $10 in the machine and expect to get 5 drinks free. They've always been completely fair with me and honest with me and I appreciate that. I've watched customers go in there and expect the bartender to give them everything in the world and because they don't they think that's bad service. It's just business $10 does not get you a bunch of drinks free. I've also watch customers go in there expect free food and drink for playing $20 but sitting there for 4 hours playing one quarter every 10 minutes and drinking their buns off. Good grief, people always expecting something for nothing. And then they don't even tip. Timbers is always been a great place to go and hang out and have a nice time. I still enjoy going there after 10 years. And I will continue to go there when I have the opportunity because Jason, Heather, Robert and all of the other servers have been great. They have to be doing something right to keep me going back all of these years and I am a trainer for customer service and have been for 20 years. Keep it up guys!!!!!!!!

Reading over the other reviews I'm noticing a trend.....terrible customer service. Wish I could say my review will be different buuuut nope. I've been here several times and I would say the service is mediocre at best but this time was awful. I'm actually currently sitting here wondering if our server will ever come back. She sure looks like she's been having a great time tonight chattin it up with the other employees but considering we are her ONLY TABLE maybe she could stop by once or twice every hour to check on us. Guess they don't want us to spend more money. Oh and also this is pretty good - had empty beer glasses sitting in front of us for at least 20 minutes so I brought them to the bar and waited for new ones. Genius bartender- "can I help you with something?" Um yeah a drink. Seriously?
Service is amazing, bartenders are friendly and fast. love the food (especially the chili)!

I am absolutely appalled at the service, or lack there of, that I received last night. First, my boyfriend and I sat in the dining area around 7:30pm, the bar was not full and only a couple tables were occupied in the rest of the dining room. I instantly noticed the two bartenders, either eating or on their phones. After not being approached by a server for fifteen minutes I got up and ordered drinks at the bar. It took a good five minutes to be noticed as the bartenders were obviously preoccupied. Finally the female bartender came over and poured the drinks. I handed her my card and she took about ten minutes to run the card because she stopped to chat with another customer. I went back to the table and at this point my boyfriend informed me that a server had been to the table next to us twice, to drop off menus and then to drop off drinks. Not once did she ask us if we needed help or even make eye contact. I was in the service industry for years thus I am an extremely understanding person when it comes to service. We ended up sitting there for 45 minutes waiting to order food. Once again I got up and went to the bar, I asked the bartender if it was possible to order food with him as not one server had come our way. He looked around for the server (instead of providing the customer service and taking my order to her) and said "Yes, I will have her come over but you will have to wait a few minutes... I don't want to tick her off"...... I thought I was being Punk'd. YOU ARE WORRIED ABOUT PISSING YOUR SERVER OFF IF YOU ASK FOR HER ASSISTANCE EVEN THOUGH I HAVE BEEN WAITING FOR IT FOR ABOUT AN HOUR NOW?! Don't worry about the fact that I was pretty "ticked off" about the lack of service..and now this? I have never been so shocked by someone's lack of respect or desire to help. I went to sit back down and the bartender had notified the server, she looked over at us then turned around and went back to talking to other customers. She obviously knew I was not happy. It was evident no one was willing to help so we stormed out. My boyfriend just moved around the corner from this Timbers location which we thought would be very convenient... but he and I both REFUSE to ever return. This place is a POS and its a wonder they are even open. To the owner, do yourself a favor and get new staff.

We stopped by for happy hour on a Friday night.  Long story short is that our two orders of sliders were burned and dry, and only one of our three drinks "qualified" for happy hour pricing, and then they priced it at full price on the bill, so we had to point it out to them.  One beer, 2 cocktails and 2 orders of $5 sliders cost us $31 with tip...during happy hour.   We told staff about the sliders being overcooked.  While they were apologetic, they didn't do anything to remedy it. This is the second time we've been disappointed at this location and we're not going back!
God this place sucks seriously go anywhere else and don't order a Bloody Mary unless you're looking for a cold glass of tomato paste

Been here a few times. I do like the bar, good hangout. The food is surprisingly good. Had a few different things off the menu, and was satisfied each time. The service sometimes is good. Hard to land a spot at the bar, lots of gamblers. Two pool tables, and darts,. That is all.

If I could offer a NEGATIVE star, I would. My husband and I went TWICE and the second time, got charged for 3 drinks AFTER dumping OVER $200 into a machine!!!!  I asked to speak to the manager and I was told 'Jason' is the manager and he told ME I played for enough to get free drinks BUT my husband did not so he charged us for his drinks.  He ADMITTED I lost HUNDREDS yet, since my husband hadn't played fast enough or LOST enough....we got charged. The worst part was how INDIGNANT the 'manager' was. THAT is how you treat GOOD gamers and LOCAL customers who OWN a home down the street???  Hope it was worth it....never be back!!!!!!

Only reason I'm giving it a 1star is because after work yesterday I went to find some local spots to have a beer in my neighborhood. It was around 230 and the front doors were locked. But it says its open 24/7?????

I came up with a new term to define this cuisine. I feel this term accurately captures both the style of food this establishment purveys as well as the level of commitment it demonstrates to quality and service.

That term is "crud-ordinary"

Websters dictionary defines normal as "having no no special or distinctive features; normal". 

The term crud is defined as "nonsense" or "a substance that is disgusting or unpleasant". The latter sense of the word, however, is more pertinent for this review.

I can confidently assert that Timbers will NOT disappoint if what you seek is a meal that is an interesting mix of something entirely recognizable and familiar, yet which could very well be your worst imaginable version of that cuisine. 

Take the meat sandwich I ordered this evening. It was absolutely a meat sandwich. There was bread and there was meat. It therefore unequivocally delivered on its promise of being a sandwich. However, its flavor was that of watery gravy drenched in cardboard. The dipping sauce looked brown and zesty and yet despite that promise, still tasted like your grandma's grimy dishwater - or at least, if I can be so bold, how I imagine her grimy dishwater might taste. 

This exotic fusion of the comfortably recognizable and the deeply, viscerally disappointing is the very hallmark of the cuisine I dub "crud-ordinary". 

Let us turn now to the quality of service lavished upon us and accompanying this desultory, disappointing excuse for a meal. The service, also, was deeply crud-ordinary. It was familiar, insofar as the food did arrive. However, it also demonstrated exemplary levels of suckage given that it was  an hour later than the anticipated delivery time. 

That is sixty whole minutes of added anticipation and expectation. Sixty whole minutes of extra annoyance and disappointment as we cracked open the styrofoam to reveal our exquisitely crud-ordinary dishes. 

Don't order your food from here. Just don't. You are a more worthy and deserving human being than should eat here. I don't care if you walk poor old grannies across the road and leave them stranded on the median strip. You're STILL worthy of better cuisine than this. It's horrible.

We ate toast and yogurt instead of finishing these meals. Toast and freaking yogurt! This is how deeply, impossibly and absolutely crud-ordinary this place is. 

Do yourself a favor and do what I should have done. Move on. Eat something else. Just ... don't.

Really hate to drop my review, but my most recent visit warranted it. 

Let's start off by stating that I am Niner Faithful.  Came out to a few games last year and enjoyed the ambiance.  Nothing but red, nothing but the Niner Empire, and nothing but fans like me.  Always enjoyed the food, the drinks, and the camaraderie with fellow Faithfuls. 

However, I have to drop by review rate just based on the size of this location.  If you're not early enough, you'll have nowhere to sit.  And when you have nowhere to sit, good luck on getting anything to eat.  Drinks won't be a problem, but grub will. 

I also quit smoking about 3 months ago and never noticed how bad this place reeked of smoke. until now. Yes, you will smell like an ashtray coming out of here. 

Wish this place was a little bigger or at least aired better.  Love the staff, love the fans, and like the food.  But it's tough for me to make this my Niner spot when I get a headache from all the smoke.

I wasn't very hungry but my wife and I had a coupon so we decided to stop for dinner and a few drinks. I decided on the buffalo chicken wrap, and I can't  imagine giving a buffalo chicken wrap at a bar a 5 star review, but here I am doing just that. 

Staff: Very friendly! Julia was very attentive and didn't miss a beat. 

Environment: when we first walked in, there were a few people smoking at the bar and being a non-smoker I was like "crap!" But the ventilation system in this place rocks, we were not bothered by it at all. The music was not too loud (perfect for having a conversation).

Food: My wife had the fish and chips, the batter and fries we very tasty and the fish was well cooked. Not amazing, but good. My buffalo chicken wrap was good. The flavors in the wrap melded so well together I couldn't have enjoyed it more.

We plan to go back next weekend with family.

Service at the bar is very poor. This is the second time I have been here around the same time of night 11:30pm, 12ish. Not sure if it is because I am playing the machines but the bartender keeps walking past my empty glass several times without acknowledging me or my request for a drink. I'm sitting here now after an hour and a half band am waiting on my third drink. I have had the same bartender both times here and received the same poor service from her. She is the brunette about 5'7" with no name tag wearing a red shirt both times I have been here. Earlier she was standing to the side talking to another bartender and waitress while I and another guys were waiting for a drinks. The guy wearing a lions jersey just walks by me and has never looked my way and just as I type this he asks me if I need a drink while the gal is leaning against the back wall talking. I could go on but the bottom line is the service at the bar us very poor. The waitresses looks like she is all over the floor providing good service which is why I am referring to the bar only. I just moved to this area and am looking for a hang out in the area and timbers is definitely not the spot to feel welcomed. Now lets see if I get comped for gaming, I have a feeling I won't. Tried this place twice both times poor service so I won't be back. Two stars because the food was decent other than that the bar service gets one star.

On 6-06-17 at about 5 PM, I walked into Timbers. At first, all was well. The bartender was friendly and he greeted me as I walked in the doorway. I opened the menu and patiently waited for someone to come take my order. The bartender was busy serving patrons at the bar. Meanwhile, I noticed the waitress standing in front of a television watching a girls softball game. 

When I first entered the bar it was 5 o'clock on the dot. I glanced down at my watch and noticed it was 5:20 PM. The waitress still did not come around. Then, I moved to the other side of the bar where the high tables are located near the TV that the waitress was watching. 

At this point, the waitress disappeared to the back. Then I saw her reappear using one of the telephones near the kitchen. The time is now 5:40 PM. I had enough and could not take getting ignored any longer, so I left and went to PT's Pub where I got great service. Normally I get decent service at Timbers; however, this incident changed my view about the establishment.l
Great service love it had a good time they are very nice the food  is great my servers heather was so nice  and it's so clean

Luv coming here!!! I'm always treated like family when I came here!!! Love their chicken tenders. Spicy honey garlic it's so good!!! And omg can Jason please get a break!!! He's always cleaning and running around lol not "Fatty" but he's awesome too
Ariana was very sweet and attentive. My usual turkey burger with no cheese was amazing and onion rings great!! Country music playing (very cool). Cozy feeling, good food

The service here was amazing.  I went with my aunt, uncle, cousin and their friends last weekend after church for lunch and didn't expect much based on the appearance, but my chicken sandwich and fries were delicious, and I loved the heaping servings of cold ice tea with lemon.  I thought it was a tad ridiculous that even though they separated our checks, they wouldn't let us use more than one coupon at the table?  Nevertheless we had a nice lunch and the server was very attentive and friendly.  Almost everyone took food home with them because the servings were overly generous.

This is only getting four stars because I have had a few bad meals here but the reason it's getting four stars is because of Renee! She's the best host/waitress there. Very attentive and nice. Remembers our names and orders every time we come in. We go on certain days to ensure she's there. The owner/ male bartender is great too. Make sure to ask for Rebee when you go in!!

Don't get the nachos here they are dry and the condiments are sparing so it's literally like eating chips and nothing else also the tacos are huge and gross don't bother with them either. Wait staff is always really nice here and all the bartenders are really attentive to you whether you are playing video poker or not. I will reccomened the farm burger with fries it's a decent sized burger and the portion of fries you get is just right another plus is that they actually cook it to order not just pretend to by asking how you would like it cooked as some other restaurants do. There are two pool table here and most of the time they are open also some casual seating in the front for a more relaxed stay than at the bar or bar tables.
As always a warm welcome when I came in from Heather and Rob. I had great service from Stephanie for my food and the food was good.
Amazing always! Ask for Christin she is always so sweet and keeps the drinks coming. Please try this place you won't be sorry. Make sure she waits on you and tip her well!

Horrible service from the bartenders. I work right across the street and I will go to any other bar before I return here. I was ignored when I got there and the most shocking part was when they asked the lady sitting right next to me (who happened to just hit a royal) if she was doing ok, but still didn't ask me. I had to ask them for wine after they asked the big winner next to me. Not 2 seats over, literally right next to me! Thanks, but no thanks. A simple "hello, can I get you something to drink?" would have made all the difference in the world. No more Timbers, N Durango, for this lady!

First time for me eating at this timbers location and I was very impressed ! I was greeted as soon as I walked in the door. Sat right away. Everything was quick and efficient. Food was amazing as always. Definitely will be back!

I go to this Timbers all the time and definitely keep returning to this location because we always receive really good service. They revamped their menu not too long ago and it's pretty good too. The only reason why I didn't give 5 stars is because I think they could do better on their happy hour specials.

I don't get the low reviews. PEOPLE.... ITS A BAR, a local neighborhood tavern, public house, speak easy. I always order take out. I've had the bacon cheeseburger with Swiss and fries. It's always good. The Bozeman beef was really good, except not a complaint but more of a suggestion, the Au Jus is really strong flavored, not salty, just really bold and rich. They could actually cut food costs by diluting it 1/2 oz of water to 4 oz of au jus. I put a little water in mine and it was bomb. My order is always ready within 20 minutes. They don't charge me extra for ranch for my fries (but I only get one little container). REMEMBER... it is a bar with bar food. I'll only accept the comments about bad customer service cuz that's the people. It's not fine dining on the strip. It's not a Michelin star restaurant. It's a bar with bar food. Quick, greasy, and delicious. I've never had a bad experience at this place. I've been here many times in the past to sit down and have breakfast. Lately I've been doing takeout.  I always get the chicken fries steak and eggs. I know where I am eating and do not expect anymore than I should. This place is a good local bar.

They have a great menu, but if you can't get what you order, it sucks! Bartender Leanne says I can get hash browns instead of fries and then brings fries. Disappointed.  She was telling her patrons about all the shots she had last night
Bartenders and Service is fantastic!! Thanks to Jason for always making my time enjoyable.  Good bar food as well with great drink specials during happy hour.
This place has some of the best bar food in Vegas. The staff are attentive and Amber is one cute waitress. Plus she's always checking to make sure you're happy.

I was unable to give no stars to post this warning. Do not go to this Timbers if you want to have a great night out! The male bartenders are so rude!!! I have lived in vegas for 28 years,I've been a cocktail waitress in some major casinos and was a bartender for 4 years in some local joints so I know when you have a playing customer you serve them drinks on the house. This bartender wanted to charge me and when I asked why he was charging me when I am playing fully load video poker he went ape shit on me!! So I cashed out and he was still yelling at me,told me to get the F out. I said I'm trying to just give me my money. He then threw the money at me. When I called the next day to report him the manager defended the bartender ,saying we can charge for drinks. I never was charged for drink during the day by the female bartenders.  I think it's a scam in there. Graveyard bartenders don't make money so they charge for drinks,pockets that money and the tip money. No wonder why he went crazy on me. I'll never set foot back in there ever and if your smart either will you! Bad business!

Way too smokey.......come home and have to leave your clothes outside to air out BEFORE you wash them....

Unless you are a regular, the staff isn't too friendly. 

This is the closest bar to my house but will defiantely drive a bit further to BWW!

The bar food was good so we tolerated getting to-go items. Even then it sometimes was spotty service and it was always from the same server. Black hair, really bubbly and friendly which makes her scattered with no priorities except to chat and have fun. 

She's the reason why we always check sauces as it normally isn't always there. I've gotten salad without a dressing or fries without ranch sauce. If we deal with someone else, there's usually not as much issue. 

After last night, screw this place. 

Called in the order and it usually takes 10-15 minutes. The BF gets there soon after to pick it up and lets that server know he's here for a pick up. She goes to the back and says it's a few minutes. He tries to get her several times. It took forever to get the food and when the BF pays and she brings him the food, he asks for sauces that wasn't given. The girl goes off then to drop off a drink, but then goes to chat with some people, and off elsewhere, gets people their checks, etc. before going to just grab the BF some ranch, malt vinegar and tartar sauce. At this point the BF has already been waiting 30minutes plus on a order that was called in 50 minutes ago so he was quite miffed that this lady has no concept of priorities. When a customer is needing to leave, then don't hold them hostage! He sat for a few minutes too many for some sauce.

58 minutes for food. When we open the food- it was cold and soggy. I didn't get tartar sauce for my fish and chips. I live two blocks from this place so it didn't get cold on a travel home. It's the reason why we pick up here- the proximity should get us hot food. 

The food was done probably the timeframe they said, but that lady didn't go get the food and wandered around chatting up people. 

One server can ruin repeat business.

Great local bar. Usually decent service both day and night. I've gambled and didn't get any drinks comp'd, but drink prices aren't bad. Breakfast is actually a good thing there. Love the big chairs in the bar area's table section too.
Been sitting here for exactly 10 min.  Place is damn near empty.  Waitress walks by twice and doesn't say a word or ask us for our order.  Guess we don't get to try the food....leaving
I order nachos 10 dollar nachos and had them delivered...no cheese...or very little cheese...I thought cheese was one of the mail ingredients in Nacho's...but I must be wrong

What's not to like about this place! I've been here at least 15 times within the past 3 months and every time it is the same and I know what I can expect. First off the Happy hour is amazing! $2.50 drinks and during the summer they have food specials after 12! I love that they have that promo and I hope they don't stop it! It really provides a great chance to try something new on their menu that I normally would not try. Food always comes out very fast! The woman server Christin is amazing and I've had some questions on menu items and she took the time to make sure I knew what I was ordering and that I would enjoy it! This place is great and I don't know how it only has the 2 1/2 star rating, because honestly you can't beat those prices at a station casino! I will tell everyone I know about this place and their good specials they offer.
Nothing good to say about the place.  The bartenders sucked and the food was very mediocre.  Should have went to The Lodge down the road instead.

I LOVE this place, great food, great drinks and an amazing staff that are always welcoming and friendly. Moved here a year ago and this is my favorite place to wind down and enjoy the company after a long, stressful week. The staff at Timbers Durango and Dorrell has truly made me feel like family. Thank You Jason and Jason, Jay, Jade, Hearher, Leanna, Jim, Arianna, Tim... Love you alll!!!!!!! Stacy Romero 
A+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
I love this Timbers! I've been coming here every weekend for a while now and we have hardly ever been disappointed!  Julia is the best server and the food is yummy!
Great food! Pick-up is fast and easy. Only wish they would offer their breakfast menu on their Grubhub delivery service.

If you go THURSDAY or FRIDAY mornings expect to be greeting at served by a very sexual attractive Jade olive skin beautiful bartender!  She pours a cold beer, kills it at giving patrons luck on the machines and you'll see and makes YUMMA lemon drops!   Tell her Famous Jameous sent you.  You won't be let down!!!!

The only reason I am giving 2 stars is because Jaime the bartender is amazing! My friends & I came here for St. Patrick's Day & we had HORRIBLE service from Lucia. We got here at 8:20 pm & left at 11:15 & had 3 drinks while we were here because she took so long. Also got one of our orders wrong & even said "sorry I took so long I was doing my side work" just so she could clock out of work. The "manager" Jason didn't even do anything about it. Anyways, it was an all around upset.

Cool neighborhood spot to throw a few cold beverages back.  

Excellent spicy bloody-mary!! 

The bartenders are all unique and cool in their own way.  

French Toast at 1:30 am I was in heaven!

This place is horrible. They have good pool tables and an excellent dartboard, and even good food. All of this is negated by their service. I have been over/double charged too many times for drinks. this happened twice. the first time i figured it was just an inattentive bartender or less than desirable employee; however, after the second time i realized it is a common practice there.  dog bites you once shame on the dog, dog bites you twice shame on you. There wont be a third time this dog bites me. DONT go here. Drinks are over priced, specials that are advertised dont show up on the bill and the service is horrible. if it wasnt 5 mins from my house i would never have gone back a second time. Avoid this place at all costs, or it will cost you.

This bar sucks!! I will never go back!!! The bartenders were all nasty and mean!!! They kicked me off the machine because I was only betting 25cents a hand. Seriously!?? They were the rudest bartenders I have ever experienced!!! Please do not go to this bar!!! There are tons of better bars in town!!! I'm putting my money in the machine and also buying drinks and your gonna come over and be an a** and push the cash out button and tell me to get off when I have done nothing wrong!!?? 

Worst bar ever!!!

Up here in the northwest we have a lot of options on local bars to go to, but I always choose to go here. I usually drop in during swing shift and Rob and Heather take great care of me whether I'm gambling or not. They always remember my drink and are great at making sure it doesn't go dry. All the staff makes great conversation and makes you feel welcome. The food is consistently good, especially the steak sandwich and late night/early morning breakfast. Plus they're one of the only places that carries Coors Banquet!

The food was amazing and drinks were well made.  I was here around midnight on a weekend and it wasn't very busy.  Our server, I think her name was Amber, was super friendly and personable.  I'm not a smoker and hate leaving any place smelling like one, so that is my only complaint.  I know... I know... I can already hear a few people saying, "Then don't go to bars."  As a non-smoker there are other bars with equally amazing food and fresh air that I would choose over going back here on that alone and that keeps this from being a five star establishment in my book.

I love the fact that I can come in and have great food, drink,  and a chat before a busy saturday.  This place is great for breakfast.  Its clean, smoke free, and friendly.  My husband I can split a breakfast,  the portions are so generous.  And our friend Anne Marie is always there ready for us.   If you come in, ask to sit in her area; shes the bomb.com.
